{"step_by_step_thinking": "The latent phase of labour is the first stage of labour, it starts with contractions of the uterus and ends with the active phase of labour. This is described in Document [2]. It is also mentioned in Document [2] that the latent phase can sometimes be confused with false labour due to mild cramps. However, there is no information in the provided documents that suggests that the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) states that the latent phase starts after 3-4 cm cervical dilatation and that they are planning to increase it to 5 cm.", "answer_choice": "A"}
